select1.label: Pelvic floor exercises- (start exercise as soon after birth as possible. But if urinary catheter is in place, wait until it is removed) -Sit, stand or lie down on your side. Imagine that you are trying to stop yourself passing wind and at the same time try and stop the flow of urine. -The feeling should be that squeeze and lift, closing and drawing up the back and front passages -Hold for as long as possible, upto 10 seconds breathing normally, and then relax -Repeat upto 10 times -It is important to do this without squeezing your buttocks or squeezing legs or, without holding your breath. -Practice this set atleast 3 times a day.

Pelvic tilting exercise- -Place your hands on the abdomen -Gently tighten your tummy muscles and buttocks and allow the back of your waist to slump backwards. Your pubic bone rocks up towards you. Breath normally and hold the tilt for 5-10 secs. -Relax and allow your back to hollow -Repeat a few times -Practicing the abdominal exercise is best done in the neutral spine position

TrA exercise- -Place your hands on the lower part of abdomen -Take a gentle breathe -As you breath out, gently draw in and lift the lower tummy away from from your hand, this time not allowing your back to move. -Keeping the tummy in, continue to breathe normally a few times -Feel the muscles working under your hand as it supports the weight of your baby -Relax -Repeat upto 10 times -Repeat this 6 to8 times a day -Try in different positions, and try to use this muscle during activity requiring effort.

Knee bends- -In crook lying, draw in the lower tummy, keeping the back still and bend one hip and knee up as far as it is comfortable. Hold for 10 secs and slowly lower. Breathe easily throughout. Repeat with the other leg. If able, repeat another 3 times for each side.

Knee rolling- -In crook lying with lower tummy drawn in, gently lower both knees to the right as far as is comfortable, bring them back to the middle and relax, breathing easily throughout. Draw in the lower tummy and repeat to the other side. Repeat three times to each side. -Women should be advised to aim to practice abdominal exercises 3 times a day at least 3 months after birth
